list_definition.definition: to lie back in a casual manner

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Paula was lounging on a sofa.

list_definition.definition: to move about lazily; to be inactive

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I spent the day lounging about the house.

list_definition.definition: a sitting-room, eg in a hotel

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They watched television in the hotel lounge.

list_ex_of_english: Will it be available for things other than bedrooms, such as sun lounges, which are very popular in many parts of the country, or conference facilities?
There are lounges on both floors and the atmosphere is self-evidently happy.
I do not think that drink for young people in expensively decorated, curtained and well-furnished lounges is any less a danger than it is in a bar.
Many of the clubs and lounges have single narrow exits and entrances either upstairs or downstairs.
I am not necessarily advocating this, but longer intervals between films, enabling people to spend more time in bars and lounges, might be the answer.
There are lounges and study rooms on each floor, including a building game room.
Many establishments previously in other trades are being converted into unauthorised cinemas and video lounges.
Will there be an enlargement of the existing lounges, which are so small, where people have to wait when they want to board a plane or when they arrive?
